alert.note: Alert for Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:48PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dolores, or 34 miles northwest of Durango, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Dolores and north central Montezuma Counties, including the following locations... Stoner. This includes Colorado 145 between mile markers 12 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains
